alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 15 at 1:52PM EDT until August 15 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Hart County in northeastern Georgia... South central Anderson County in Upstate South Carolina... West central Abbeville County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 152 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles southwest of Hartwell, or over Bowman, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Iva, Bowman, Dewy Rose, Rock Branch, Nuberg, Vanna, Starr, Lowndesville, Royston and Lake Russell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
